title: Why is Nocturne not included in the upcoming Assassin Rework ?
body:
I mean he is an Assassin that clearly isn't on the best Spot and could use some love. His Kit is linear and the really unique Ability is his Ultimate ( and maybe his Fear ) that fits into his whole " Nightmare " Theme. 
Still he is one of my favorite Champions and im really curious what is gonna happen to him.

replies.body: We feel Nocturne's a diving fighter, rather than an assassin. Those two groups have some strong similarities, with both aiming to get onto and explode a valuable squishy target. Assassins are burstier, with primarily ability based damage, generally a lack of CC and usually some need to flank to get onto the target they want. Divers have slower damage, a bit of tankiness, generally rely a lot on their auto attacks, bring a moderate amount of CC and can often go straight into a team fight. Nocturne's got a theme that's pretty assassin like, his gameplay puts him solidly into the diver category though.
Thanks for the Reply. Do you have any Plans for the Future when talking about Nocturne  ? @Meddler

Nothing concrete. I expect we'd probably do some small work on him if we did a diving fighter update someday. Doubt he'd be one of the champs to get major changes though, he's reasonably distinct and other divers need the work a lot more (Aatrox, Xin, probably Wukong etc).

You could build AD Malphite and do the same thing. You can make any champion into an assassin (or a tank, as we've seen with Fizz, Ekko, etc) or whatever. The fact is that Nocturne benefits more as a tanky DPS champion with good sustained damage than a 'one and done' assassin. He has burst, yes, but unlike Assassins, he's not limited to one spell rotation to do his damage. He can burst and then stay in the fight slugging it out, something that most assassins can't do.

Your malphite example is the dumbest thing I've ever read. As malphite has no burst since his abilities scale off of ap and armor. Also check in high Elo from time to time and see how people build nocturne there. Hint : it's full ad armor pen. You see nocturne is a flexible champion he succeeds as a dps fighter and as an ad assassin.

> You see nocturne is a flexible champion he succeeds as a dps fighter and as an ad assassin.

Nice straw-man argument.

Read my post again. Nocturne can burst, I'm not disputing that. I'm disputing that his 'best playstyle' so to speak is that of an assassin. Out of Nocturne's 3 standard abilities, only his Q and E do damage, and only his Q scales off AD. His main form of damage is from auto attacks, heck that's a huge point of his Q, to buff his auto attacks. Compare this to someone like Talon, as you mentioned above, and you can see that Talon does the job of an assassin much better than Nocturne because **all** of his abilities do damage, and they do damage quickly without having to weave in auto attacks. However, unlike Talon, Nocturne is not completely useless if he runs out of mana or has his abilities on cooldown, because of his naturally higher attack speed (passive on W) and his regular passive. 

Also, perhaps I should have been more clear with my AD Malphite example. I know that Malphite scales off of AP. That was my point, to show you that even champions that scale off of a completely different stat can be made to work in certain situations with a completely wrong build. LankPants understood what I was trying to say. A fed Nocturne can build full damage and be an assassin, sure, but that's not going to work the majority of the time. The nature of Nocturne's kit is strange in that it leans  towards 1v1 assassination as well as bigger fights, I'll give you that. But I think, as a whole, being able to dive into the enemy team, lock down a carry, avoid CC, and then do sustained damage is a more effective way to play Nocturne than simply going in to assassinate someone and not caring if you die afterwards. 

You wouldn't build Malphite AD because you waste his utility as a tank; so too you shouldn't build Nocturne as a full damage assassin because you waste his utility as a diver.

> Out of Nocturne's 3 standard abilities, only his Q and E do damage,

Poor argument. Out of the 3 standard abilities for Talon and Zed, only two do damage.

> and you can see that Talon does the job of an assassin much better than Nocturne because all of his abilities do damage, and they do damage quickly without having to weave in auto attacks.

You clearly don't play Talon. Not only does Talon's E not do damage, he weaves in about 3 auto attacks in a combo if you include Q, two if not. Which is the same amount you'd have with a burst style Nocturne. And Nocturne gets it done faster and from greater range.

I downvoted you because of the straw-man argument part. Anyone who *needs* to rely on the crutch of pointing out logical fallacies of others as if their argument suddenly holds no weights clearly has weak arguments themselves. After reading your post I can see I wasn't wrong.

IMO, Nocturne's best playstyle currently is an assassin. Itemization/masteries are very favorable for that build at the moment, and frankly bruiser nocturne just isn't all that effective compared to other picks. To a certain extent, this may reflect more on the state of nocturne as a bruiser than the strength of him as an assassin, but he is still a pretty effective one.

Nocturne may have less burst than other assassins but it is far more reliable burst. It's virtually impossible to escape from one (and very difficult to do anything about getting bursted). An unstoppable semi-global point and click dash that does a substantial amount of damage and denies vision is an incredibly powerful tool for an assassin, and it more than makes up for having slightly less burst than some other assassins.

Furthermore, just using autos doesn't mean that you aren't an assassin. Rengar's damage is almost all autos and almost everyone would call him an assassin. Even Zed and Talon rely on a substantial amount of autoattacking to make the most out of their kit.

THEN GIVE HIM A FIGHTERS BASE STATS. He's way to squishy to be a diving fighter. He needs a longer duration spell shield or the same base defensive stats as say xin or Vi. He's underpowered compared to other champs right now, which is a shame, because he is fun.

Since his theme is very much an assassin theme, have you ever thought about giving him work to make him more of an assassin? I realize that would require some very significant work, since the only ability on his kit that is very solidly an assassin ability is his ultimate, but I'm just wondering whether you think the kit should change to match the theme, or if perhaps the theme should change a bit to match the kit.

Another, more general question - how do you guys decide when to work on champions who exist on the border of classes? Nocturne currently plays like a diving fighter but is themeatically an assassin, so you guys are want to work on him with the diving fighter class, right? So with him, you are working on him based on his current gameplay. But the opposite is true of Diana, who, while thematically a fighter, is currently played fully as an assassin. With Diana, Riot has also said that they are going to work on her with the diving fighter class, even though thats not the class she functions as currently. So she is being worked on based on her theme, not her gameplay. Is this someting that is being decided on a champion-by-champion basis, or is the goal here simply to keep the assassin update small?
